page.title: 10Communications in Aith
page.content: The Post Office. Most of the services the post office provides are well used. The incoming mail is sorted at Bixter, the next post office, and delivered from there. The outgoing mail is sorted at Aith then put to the head office at Lerwick. The Telephone. The telephone is widely used. Of the 75 houses in the block, 59 have phones. The only kiosk in the block is by the post office. C.B.Radio. C.B. is popular in Shetland and is extensively used. There are a number of C.B.ers in the block. Television and Radio. Most people have t.v. and radio. Generally Shetland can receive all four channels but most of this block cannot receive Channel 4 at the moment. There is a local radio station which provides local news and programmes of local interest.
